column2: // terms of use posted at: http://www.moock.org/terms/
// These are the user defined globals.
// Modify the following variables to customize the inspection behaviour.
var requiredVersion = 8;   // Version the user needs to view site (max 6, min 2)
var useRedirect = true;    // Flag indicating whether or not to load a separate
// page based on detection results. Set to true to
// load a separate page. Set to false to embed the
// movie or alternate html directly into this page.
// Only set next three vars if useRedirect is true...
var flashPage = "gsa.cfm?pid=556&version=flash&detect=done"      // The location of the flash movie page
var noFlashPage = "gsa.cfm?pid=556&version=html"  // Page displayed if the user doesn't have the
// plugin or we can't detect it.
var upgradePage = "update_flash.html"  // Page displayed if we detect an old plugin
// Everything below this point is internal until after the BODY tag.
// Do not modify! Proceed to the BODY tag for further instructions.
var flash2Installed = false;    // boolean. true if flash 2 is installed
var flash3Installed = false;    // boolean. true if flash 3 is installed
var flash4Installed = false;    // boolean. true if flash 4 is installed
var flash5Installed = false;    // boolean. true if flash 5 is installed
var flash6Installed = false;    // boolean. true if flash 6 is installed
var flash7Installed = false;    // boolean. true if flash 6 is installed
var flash8Installed = false;    // boolean. true if flash 6 is installed
var maxVersion = 8;             // highest version we can actually detect
var actualVersion = 0;          // version the user really has
var hasRightVersion = false;    // boolean. true if it's safe to embed the flash movie in the page
var jsVersion = 1.0;            // the version of javascript supported
// Check the browser...we're looking for ie/win
var isIE = (navigator.appVersion.indexOf("MSIE") != -1) ? true : false;    // true if we're on ie
var isWin = (navigator.appVersion.indexOf("Windows") != -1) ? true : false; // true if we're on windows
// This is a js1.1 code block, so make note that js1.1 is supported.
// Write vbscript detection on ie win. IE on Windows doesn't support regular
document.write('</SCR' + 'IPT\> \n'); // break up end tag so it doesn't end our script
// Next comes the standard javascript detection that uses the
// navigator.plugins array. We pack the detector into a function so it loads
// Some version of Flash was found. Time to figure out which.
// Set convenient references to flash 2 and the plugin description.
// DEBUGGING: uncomment next line to see the actual description.
// A flash plugin-description looks like this: Shockwave Flash 4.0 r5
// We can get the major version by grabbing the character before the period
// note that we don't bother with minor version detection.
// Do that in your movie with $version or getVersion().
// We found the version, now set appropriate version flags. Make sure
// to use >= on the highest version so we don't prevent future version
// Loop through all versions we're checking, and
// set actualVersion to highest detected version.
// If we're on webtv, the version supported is 2 (pre-summer2000,
// or 3, post-summer2000). Note that we don't bother sniffing varieties
// of webtv. You could if you were sadistic...
// DEBUGGING: uncomment next line to display flash version
// We're finished getting the version on all browsers that support detection.
// Time to take the appropriate action.
// If the user has a new enough version...
// ...then we'll redirect them to the flash page, unless we've
// It's safe to use replace(). Good...we won't break the back button.
// JavaScript version is too old, so use .location to load
// If we got here, we didn't redirect. So we make a note that we should
// write out the object/embed tags later.
// The user doesn't have a new enough version.
// If the redirection option is on, load the appropriate alternate page.
// Do the same .replace() call only if js1.1+ is available.
detectFlash();  // call our detector now that it's safely loaded.

column2: HTML VERSION

column1: <div style="display: none; height: 1px; width: 1px; overflow: hidden;">

column3:
THE CREATIVE FUTURES FUND - ENRICHING THE STUDENT EXPERIENCE

Amazing is a word often used to describe The Glasgow School of Art. But so is inspiring, innovative and intuitive. To say nothing of exciting, exhilarating and exceptional.

Indeed, if accolades were money, we'd be the richest art school in the world. But, unfortunately, they're not. Which is why we need your help.

With the support of our alumni and friends, we can ensure that the GSA continues to break new ground in the study of fine art, design and architecture. The Creative Futures Fund will help us achieve this aim by providing unrestricted funds which can be directed where they are needed most across the School.

We have achieved much at the GSA. We want to achieve even more. The Creative Futures Fund is a unique opportunity for alumni and friends of the GSA to help the next generation of artists, designers and architects realise their full potential. It will ensure that all students are able to benefit from the same quality of learning, teaching and opportunity as those who have gone before.

For example, your support could help the Library increase its provision for students with disabilities - significantly improving their access to learning materials - or could match support from the School's own resources to provide advanced IT facilities or specialist equipment across the GSA. It could help facilitate student access to lectures and seminars by international artists, designers and architects, which may not currently be possible.

Facilities like these should be an integral part of our students' day-to-day life - not luxuries to be dreamt about. With your help, we can make them a reality. Whatever the size of your donation, you can be assured that it will have a direct and positive impact on both today's students and those yet to walk through our doors.

Not only that, but a commitment on your part will serve to strengthen our approaches to major funding bodies such as trusts, foundations and companies. By demonstrating the wholehearted backing of the GSA community, we can show other potential supporters that the people who know it best - you, our alumni and friends - care enough about its future to contribute to it. With your help, we will ensure that the GSA continues to make its influence felt across the globe.

One of the best ways to support the Creative Futures Fund is through a regular donation, either monthly or annually, through Gift Aid (if you are a UK taxpayer). If just 100 alumni and friends chose to support the Creative Futures Fund with a donation of £10 per month for four years, the Fund would grow by over £61,500.

Alternatively, you can make a one-off donation to the Fund, again through Gift Aid, maximising the value of your donation.

However you choose to support the Creative Futures Fund, you can be confident in the knowledge that you will making a significant difference to current and future students of the GSA. With your help, GSA students will continue to make their mark on the world in the years to come.

Support the Creative Futures Fund Now

MORE INFORMATION?

For further information on the Creative Futures Fund, and methods of giving, please contact us at:

Development & External Relations Office
The Glasgow School of Art
167 Renfrew Street
Glasgow
G3 6RQ

+44 (0)141 353 4788
+44 (0)141 353 4401
dero@gsa.ac.uk
